lines.speaker: Mistress Sidequest
lines.text: Ah, another lost soul. Let me guess: no map, no clues, and spamming dash like that counts as stylish evasion, right?

lines.speaker: Vin
lines.text: I dash with surgical precision, thank you. And I'm way better equipped than you.

lines.speaker: Mistress Sidequest
lines.text: Oh, shiny armor and proper weapons. How offensive to the narrative of suffering. I see you really took 'it's dangerous to go alone' to heart.

lines.speaker: Vin
lines.text: I thought the ‘barely surviving’ look was optional.

lines.speaker: Mistress Sidequest
lines.text: Nope, it's part of the ambiance. But hey, there's always one who shows up prepared.

lines.speaker: Vin
lines.text: Let me guess—now you hand me a magic spoon and a tragic backstory no one asked for?

lines.speaker: Mistress Sidequest
lines.text: Close. Tragedies unlock in the DLC. For now, take this flask and a vague sense of impending failure.

lines.speaker: Mistress Sidequest
lines.text: And if you were looking for your prince, he’s in another castle—probably dating some emotionally unstable dragon.

lines.speaker: Mistress Sidequest
lines.text: Also, here's this potion. It heals absolutely nothing unless you genuinely care about something in life.

lines.speaker: Vin
lines.text: Then I’m doomed. I barely care enough to water my plants.

lines.speaker: Vin
lines.text: (Yup. Definitely my favorite NPC so far.)
